info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 9:02PM PST until November 21 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Southern Los Angeles County.
* WHEN...Until 300 AM PST Friday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rainfall falling across portions of southern Los Angeles County. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.40 inch per hour have been observed in some location. Urban and small stream flooding is likely. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Minor debris flows from the Palisades burn scar are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Downtown Los Angeles, Inglewood, Torrance, Alhambra, Culver City, Hermosa Beach, Manhattan Beach, Hollywood, Redondo Beach, Griffith Park, Whittier, Beverly Hills, Universal City, Pasadena, Rancho Palos Verdes, Venice, Santa Monica, and the eastern portion of the Palisades burn scar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST FRIDAY
